intro: Antiphylla retusa, commonly known as the silky antiphylla, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and forest edges. Antiphylla retusa is often found in wetlands and is adapted to thrive in humid, temperate climates.
